creator: a_cogito@yahoo.fr
text:
I'm unable to compile JMeter from cvs sources.

Where can I find this?
    sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl

Error:
compile-core:
    [javac] Compiling 10 source files to C:\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1-
src\workspace\jakarta-jmeter\build\core
    [javac] C:\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1-src\workspace\jakarta-
jmeter\src\core\org\apache\jmeter\util\JsseSSLManager.java:118: cannot resolve 
symbol

sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl)
    [javac]                                                       ^

jmeter\src\core\org\apache\jmeter\util\JsseSSLManager.java:120: cannot resolve

I thing I have downloaded every jar necessary using either the get-bsf or get-
beanshell task or from the official site, but i won't find iSaSiLk?
"Classes for IAIK iSaSiLk not found in classpath"

using: jsse-1_0_3_03-gl.zip downloaded from: http://java.sun.com/products/jsse/

...>java -version
java version "1.3.1_03"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.1_03-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.3.1_03-b03, mixed mode)

...>ant -version
Apache Ant version 1.6.1 compiled on February 12 2004

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
jdk1.3 doesn't include encryption jars.  You should be able to download JSSE
from sun and put it in your jdk's /ext directory (or jmeter's lib dir).  Also,
you could upgrade to jdk1.4 and be all set - which is very much a better option
if you can go to 1.4 for jmeter.

creator: a_cogito@yahoo.fr
text:
I already had downloaded the jsse 1_0_3_03 jar(s) but it didn't work...

But upgrading to java 1.4 solved the problem!

Thank you very much!

--
C:\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1-src>java -version
java version "1.4.0_01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.0_01-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.0_01-b03, mixed mode)
